questions.question: What is Big Ben the nickname for?
choices: The great bell of the clock
questions.explanation: Big Ben is the nickname for the great bell of the clock at the Houses of Parliament.

questions.question: Where is Big Ben located?
questions.explanation: Big Ben is located at the Houses of Parliament in London.

questions.question: In which year was the clock tower renamed Elizabeth Tower?
questions.explanation: It was renamed Elizabeth Tower in 2012 for Queen Elizabeth II’s Diamond Jubilee.

questions.question: Where is the Eden Project located?
questions.explanation: The Eden Project is located in Cornwall, in the south-west of England.

questions.question: What are the Eden Project’s biomes like?
questions.explanation: The Eden Project’s biomes are like giant greenhouses that house plants from all over the world.

questions.question: What type of work does the Eden Project do as a charity?
questions.explanation: The Eden Project runs environmental and social projects internationally.

questions.question: Where is Edinburgh Castle located?
questions.explanation: Edinburgh Castle is located in the city of Edinburgh, Scotland.

questions.question: Who manages Edinburgh Castle?
questions.explanation: Edinburgh Castle is managed by Historic Environment Scotland.

questions.question: How old is the history of Edinburgh Castle?
questions.explanation: Edinburgh Castle dates back to the early Middle Ages.

questions.question: Where is the Giant’s Causeway located?
questions.explanation: The Giant’s Causeway is on the north-east coast of Northern Ireland.

questions.question: What is the Giant’s Causeway made of?
questions.explanation: The Giant’s Causeway was formed from volcanic lava about 50 million years ago.

questions.question: What is Loch Lomond known for?
choices: Being the largest fresh water area in mainland Britain
questions.explanation: Loch Lomond is the largest expanse of fresh water in mainland Britain.

questions.question: How large is Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park?
questions.explanation: The park covers 720 square miles (1,865 square kilometres).

questions.question: How tall is the London Eye?
questions.explanation: The London Eye is 443 feet (135 metres) tall.

questions.question: Why was the London Eye originally built?
questions.explanation: It was built as part of the UK’s celebration of the new millennium.

questions.question: Where is Snowdonia located?
questions.explanation: Snowdonia is a national park in North Wales.

questions.question: What is the highest mountain in Wales?
questions.explanation: Snowdon, located in Snowdonia, is the highest mountain in Wales.

questions.question: Who built the Tower of London?
questions.explanation: The Tower of London was built by William the Conqueror after 1066.

questions.question: Who gives tours at the Tower of London?
questions.explanation: Tours are given by Yeoman Warders, also known as Beefeaters.

questions.question: What valuable items are kept in the Tower of London?
questions.explanation: The Crown Jewels are kept and displayed at the Tower of London.

questions.question: What is England’s largest national park?
questions.explanation: The Lake District is the largest national park in England.

questions.question: Which lake is the largest in the Lake District?
questions.explanation: Windermere is the largest stretch of water in the Lake District.

questions.question: Which view was voted Britain’s favourite in 2007?
questions.explanation: In 2007, Wastwater was voted Britain’s favourite view by TV viewers.
